sub_title: Lead  Data Scientist/Risk Modelling at Stater
summary:
Gordon has 20+ years’ experience in risk modelling, data science and machine learning. He currently works at Stater  with focus on developing machine learning and AI  models for the mortgage industry.  He worked more than 15 years on risk modelling such as IFRS 9, Basel and Solvency II compliant models (PD, LGD and EAD), credit risk scoring model, prepayment model, fraud risk model. These models are used by a number of leading mortgage lenders. 
Gordon has deep knowledge in machine learning and statistical modelling algorithms. His publication 20 years ago on neural networks is still referenced in present day research. His experience in data science covers the full life cycle of modelling including model conception, model design, data preparation, statistical modelling, validation, annual review, model update and monitoring and model governance.
Gordon has worked at Norkom Technology, Shell and the University of Leiden.  He has developed a number of machine learning algorithms, models and business applications in the area of customer behavior modelling and pattern recognition for industrial data. He has published a total of 16 articles in leading scientific journals in that period.
Gordon holds a PhD in Physics from the University of Washington.

authors.headline: Lead  Data Scientist/Risk Modelling at Stater

profile_positions.description: Within the Stater Datalab,   focusing on developing leading edge machine learning and AI models with   diverse use cases involving deep learning and NLP,  predictive modelling while remaining active in risk modelling.
profile_positions.title: Lead Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for full life cycle of predictive models from model conception and data preparation to model development, validation, and implementation as well as annual reviews, updating, and monitoring
•	Developing models for leading mortgage lenders (banks and insurance companies) in the Netherlands. Models include credit risk (PD and LGD), credit risk scoring, prepayment, fraud risk, and mortgage pipeline risk and arrears collection.  
•	Exploring and applying machine learning techniques such as sentiment analysis and topic modelling (LDA) to customer service communications 
•	Coaching and supervising junior team members and M.Sc. thesis students of Econometrics or Statistics
profile_positions.title: Lead Risk Modelling Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Researched and developed several leading-edge machine learning algorithms including: regularized linear regression, SVM, decision trees, k-means clustering, association rules and backpropagation neural networks. These algorithms form the key intelligence in Norkom's flagship product called Alchemist. Norkom's Software is used by financial and telecom companies for data mining
Led predictive modelling and consulting projects for international clients including Citibank, Fortis Bank, Bank Leumi, and Sopres with measurable ROI exceeding client expectation. Led a team of highly qualified (Ph.D. level) modelling analysts.
Built up a strong modelling team in a start-up environment, while playing hands-on role in model development and project delivery to clients including: Actel (increased direct mailing response rate by 56% overall), Neckermann, Overtoom (Customer churn modelling) and SMAP (real-time scoring model for candidate selection and scripting in telemarketing).
profile_positions.title: Research Director

profile_positions.description:
Conducted research in machine learning, neural networks, and genetic algorithms.  My publication on the effect of adding noise to neural networks is still being referenced in today’s scientific research.
Developed and prototyped several pattern recognition applications of neural networks including the automatic recognition of events from seismic signals.
 Pioneered research of convolutional neural networks applied to the inversion of well log signals. Convolution neural networks form the basis in present time deep learning applications.
Managed extramural neural network research projects at Leiden University and Radboud University Nijmegen and supervised several M.Sc. thesis projects of students.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Physicist

company.name: Lorents Institute of Theoretical Physics,  Leiden University

profile_positions.company: Lorents Institute of Theoretical Physics,  Leiden University
profile_positions.description: Pioneered quantum fixed node Monte Carlo simulation on lattice model. Published a number of papers on two-dimensional Hubbard model. Collaborated with Prof. Hans Van Leeuwen in this period.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow
